private_information: I can move disks A,B,C,D,E only.
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.
I know the initial stack order on the left peg is top-to-bottom: A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J.
agent_1.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move that, together with agent_2 moves, achieves the global goal configuration. Use the exact move format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.

private_information: I can move disks F,G,H,I,J only.
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.
I know the initial stack order on the left peg is top-to-bottom: A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J.
agent_2.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move that, together with agent_1 moves, achieves the global goal configuration. Use the exact move format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver.
I must keep actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct and integrate their proposed primitive moves into a single correct plan when possible.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate proposed moves from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownward that represents the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and achieves the global goal.

public_information: This is a cooperative Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs named left, middle, right.
There are 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration on the left peg top-to-bottom is A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J.
Goal configuration is left top-to-bottom E,F,G,H,I,J, middle top-to-bottom A,D, right top-to-bottom B,C.
Agent movement restrictions exist: agent_1 may move only A,B,C,D,E and agent_2 may move only F,G,H,I,J.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: one disk at a time and no larger disk on a smaller disk.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and an expert at moving small disks under Tower of Hanoi constraints. Provide only an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each line must use the exact format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Include only moves for disks A,B,C,D,E. Ensure your moves respect Tower of Hanoi rules and are consistent with the public information and with the intention to reach the goal when combined with agent_2 moves. Do not output PDDL or additional commentary.
propose_moves.prompt: You know the initial and goal configurations from the public information and your private restriction that you may only move A,B,C,D,E. Produce the ordered list of primitive moves you propose in the exact format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Keep the list minimal but sufficient for cooperation.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and an expert at moving large disks under Tower of Hanoi constraints. Provide only an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each line must use the exact format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Include only moves for disks F,G,H,I,J. Ensure your moves respect Tower of Hanoi rules and are consistent with the public information and with the intention to reach the goal when combined with agent_1 moves. Do not output PDDL or additional commentary.
propose_moves.prompt: You know the initial and goal configurations from the public information and your private restriction that you may only move F,G,H,I,J. Produce the ordered list of primitive moves you propose in the exact format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Keep the list minimal but sufficient for cooperation.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating proposed primitive moves from agent_1 and agent_2 and producing a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward planner. Keep actions for agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the domain by prefixing predicates or action names to indicate the acting agent. Provide a single coherent PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that captures the 3 pegs, 10 disks, the movement restrictions per agent, and the initial and goal configurations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include execution traces or redundant move lists, only the domain and problem files.
pddl.prompt: You will receive two move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Integrate them and create a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. The domain must include actions that model single-disk moves and constrain which agent can perform which disk moves. The problem must encode the initial configuration and the goal configuration. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the domain and problem are solvable by FastDownward if the integrated plan is valid. Output only the domain and problem as specified between tags.
